questions.question: Outline role of procedures and functions in maintainable programs.
questions.answer:
• Procedures / functions divide the program into smaller manageable segments
• … making it more readable / easier to understand / easier to debug
• Procedures / functions with meaningful names help to provide documentation for the program / enable/help/provide abstraction
• Procedures and functions may be re-used (in the program / in other programs / as part of a library) / run from a single line
• Procedures and functions can reduce / eliminate (repeated) code

    2 : OUTPUT Number

questions.question: Write algorithm to total numbers input until 9999.9.
questions.answer:
Total ← 0
INPUT Value
WHILE Value <> 9999.9
    Total ← Total + Value
    INPUT Value
ENDWHILE
OUTPUT Total

questions.question: Write algorithm to count values > 100.
questions.answer:
Counter ← 0
INPUT Value
WHILE Value <> 9999.9
    IF Value > 100
    THEN
        Counter ← Counter + 1
    ENDIF
    INPUT Value
ENDWHILE
OUTPUT Counter

questions.question: Write pseudocode to output array contents until data ends.
questions.answer:
Count ← 1
WHILE Count <= 50 AND People[Count, 1] <> "" DO
    OUTPUT People[Count, 1]
    OUTPUT People[Count, 2]
    OUTPUT People[Count, 3]
    Count ← Count + 1
ENDWHILE

questions.question: Write pseudocode to implement bubble sort for an array of N items.
questions.answer:
FOR i ← 1 TO N - 1
    FOR j ← 1 TO N - i
        IF A[j] > A[j + 1]
        THEN
            Temp ← A[j]
            A[j] ← A[j + 1]
            A[j + 1] ← Temp
        ENDIF
    NEXT j
NEXT i
OUTPUT A

questions.question: Identify three validation checks for product code rules.
questions.answer:
• length check ... to ensure the product code entered is 6 characters in length
• format check ... to ensure the first two characters of the product code entered are "PD"
• range check ... to ensure that the value of the last four figures of the product code entered is between 1000 and 9999

questions.question: Write pseudocode to check product code is 6 characters.
questions.answer:
REPEAT
    INPUT Product
UNTIL LENGTH (Product) = 6

questions.question: Write pseudocode to check first two chars are 'PD'.
questions.answer:
REPEAT
    INPUT Product
UNTIL SUBSTRING (Product, 1, 2) = "PD"

questions.question: Write pseudocode to read file and output string in uppercase and length.

questions.question: Outline why it is useful to store data in a file.
questions.answer:
• Data stored in a file gives a permanent copy / prevents the data from being lost
• ... so it can be recalled / used again in a program / in another program
• can be stored elsewhere / transferred to another computer

questions.question: Explain why identifiers L, S, T, A not appropriate.
questions.answer:
• (The identifiers L, S, T and A) are single letters
• ... so do not give any indication of what values they hold.
• For programs to be maintainable, identifiers should have meaningful names.

questions.question: State improved identifiers for L, S, T, A.
questions.answer:
L → Largest / Maximum
S → Smallest / Minimum
T → Total / Sum
A → Average / Mean
